content.description:
This question involves processing strings of text.

Consider the following variables.

colWidth  is an  int  variable with a positive value.

text  is a  String  variable with a non-null  value.

otherText  is a  String  variable with a non-null  value.
content.question:
A code segment, which you will write, should print output according to the following rules.

If the length of  text  is greater than  colWidth,  then the value of  text  will be printed.

Otherwise, the printed output will consist of  colWidth  characters contained between two  "|"  characters. The text between the   "|"  characters will consist of a sequence of periods  ("."),  followed by the value of  text,  followed by another sequence of periods. 
The printed output will have an equal number of periods on each side of  text,  if possible. If this is not possible, then there will be one fewer period on the left side of  text  than on the right side of  text.

The intended behavior is illustrated in the following table.

Value of
colWidth
 Value of
text
Printed Output
5
"ab"
|.ab..|
5
"abc"
|.abc.|
10
"ab"
|....ab....|
10
"abc"
|...abc....|
10
"abcdefghij"
|abcdefghij|
10
"abcdefghijklmnopqrstuv"
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuv

Write a code segment to print the intended output. Your implementation must meet all specifications and conform to the examples shown in the table.
